result.execSummary:
The defendant Ismael Rivera Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $588.19 plus surcharges.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Pamela Moniz, Thomas Schoeppe, or Keith McCarty, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Angela Komp.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is sentenced to 8 years in the WSP; 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 5 years Extended Supervision consecutive to any other sentence.  Restitution ordered int the amount of $588.19.  Deft. is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning and Voting Acknowledgement given.

Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Angela Komp.  Clerk: PT
DOC has requested additional time to complete PSI.  Sentencing adj. to 1/6/15 at 11:00 AM.

Atty Komp states defendant has a revocation hearing this afternoon and requests an adj. pending the outcome of the hearing; no objection by the State.  Status Conf.  on 10/22/14 at 2:30 PM.

Defendant Ismael  Rivera appeared with Attorney Angela Komp.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Angelina Gabriele appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, trying to get the def. into the behavioral court.  Matter set over, bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Angelina Gabriele appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Angela Komp. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found.
